So far roughly half of the operating reactors in the United States have been re-licensed for another 20 years.

The lifetime matters a lot because a power plant, a nuclear plant, is very expensive to build.
So the longer period of time you can spread that capital cost over, the lower the average price of electricity, the more competitive the plant.
With age comes some other issues.
There's a design issue.
Newer designs tend to be better and safer.
